column4: hey guys. im getting a blank screen after boot. i see the ubuntu logo but then screen just goes black. how do i fix this problem?
Are you reaching till the login screen?
no, i dont see it. the screen is blank. it was working perfectly this morning.
why don't you try running a live cd and checking your grub file. Could be a problem there
And did you reach the grub stage?
Then choose a different kernel and try. Any upgrades you recently did?
well i did an update this morning and i removed this program i forgot the name. after it went blank i tried a different kernel but no luck, its the same with all of them.
so you suggest that i run the live cd and check the grub file?
can't i boot the live and ask it to reinstall the drivers or wahtever is messing
You need to install the whole distro.You wont lose your data if you have a seperate /home partition
my /home folder is in the same partition as ubuntu partition, will i lose everything?
i dont mind reinstalling ubuntu but i need to get my stuff out of the partition and i can't access to all folders when i boot from the live cd, why is that?
You can access all the folders from  a live cd.
oki doki, i will try them again.
last Q. is there a chance that i can access them files in ubuntu from windows 7?
Nope. Linux uses ext3/4 formats which are invisible to windows
There are some programs which do that but they are unreliable
ahh boohoo microsoft. well many thanks for helping me k4rt33k. really appreeshiyate it XOXOX
